src:
Southeast Asian leaders meet under US-China trade war cloud

02 Nov 2019, 00:08

BAMAKO: At least 53 soldiers and one civilian were killed in a militant attack on a military post in northern Mali on Friday, the government said.
The attack is one of the deadliest strikes against the West African country’s military in recent memory. It is still reeling from jihadist raids in late September that underscored the increasing reach and sophistication of armed groups operating in the region.
“The dispatched reinforcements found 54 bodies including one civilian, 10 survivors, and found considerable material damage. The situation is under control,” government spokesman Yaya Sangare said on Twitter in the early hours of Saturday.
The authorities first reported the attack by armed men on the army post in Indelimane, Menaka region, on Friday, but gave a lower provisional death toll.
From their stronghold in Mali, groups with Al-Qaeda and Daesh links have been able to fan out across the Sahel, destabilizing parts of Niger and Burkina Faso.
Thirty-eight Malian soldiers were killed on Sept. 30 in coordinated attacks on two army bases in central Mali, which has slipped from government control despite the presence of the French army and other international forces.
text:
"Palestinian Arab": Balfour Declaration to rob the Palestinian land from its owners

02 Nov 2019

Jamil Ashour, a member of the Central Committee of the Palestinian Arab Front, Secretary of Gaza Square, said that Balfour is not entitled to give a promise to those who do not deserve, referring to the Jews to establish a national homeland for them in Palestine, indicating that this promise was robbed Ashour pointed out that the anniversary of the Balfour Declaration 102 passes to our Palestinian people, and he still stands by the right to return to his land from which he was abandoned, at gunpoint, pointing out that Britain is The main reason for the tragedy of the Palestinians, and bear full responsibility, demanding Britain to "only "The Balfour Declaration is an unforgivable crime. The Balfour Declaration is false," he said, adding: "All that has resulted is an occupation," noting: "Occupation does not grant the right to dispose of land, not even the Mandate State." He stressed that the crime is still being paid for by the victim, our Palestinian people, and its effects are burdening him, calling for an end to the division in order to address the plots against the Palestinian cause.
